channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: China’s manufacturing output swings back into expansion in October, private survey finds
item.description: The Caixin/S&P Global manufacturing PMI came in at 50.3 in October, beating the median estimate of 49.7 in a Reuters poll.

item.title: Bank of Japan likely to stay course with a rate hike in December or January, analysts say
item.description: Stefan Angrick, associate director and senior economist at Moody's Analytics, described the tone of the BOJ's Outlook Report as being "moderately" hawkish.

item.title: Federal Reserve rate cuts could prove to be a boon for Southeast Asian economies
item.description: The central banks of both Indonesia and Thailand are attempting to maneuver themselves in the aftermath of the recent Fed cut.

item.title: UK businesses warn Labour government's tax-raising budget will hurt hiring and boost inflation
item.description: British businesses took a bruising from Finance Minister Rachel Reeves' bumper tax rising budget on Wednesday.

item.title: Apple sales rise 6%, company seeing early iPhone 16 demand
item.description: Apple reported earnings after the bell. Here are the results.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: For Big Tech, beating earnings expectations is not enough
item.description: Investors don't just expect those companies to beat estimates. They also want Big Tech to drive markets, which depends more on growth prospects than earnings.

item.title: Intel shares jump 7% on earnings beat, uplifting guidance
item.description: Intel reported better-than-expected earnings following a quarter filled with challenges.

item.title: This European island is likened to the Maldives. I stayed for a week – for $1,500
item.description: Sardinia has white beaches, turquoise sea and plenty of watersports, rather like the Maldives. And it's possible to travel inexpensively there too.

item.title: 'Silver economy' boom: China transforms kindergartens into senior care homes as demographic crisis deepens
item.description: The falling birth rates and aging population propelled businesses that used to cater to children to shift to serving a different but more abundant set of customers, the elderly.

item.title: Amazon shares pop on earnings beat, cloud growth
item.description: The company's cloud and advertising units showed strong growth.

item.title: Chinese EV maker BYD's quarterly sales overtook Tesla's for the first time
item.description: The milestone comes amid tough competition in China, the world's largest auto market, as well as higher tariffs on imports of Chinese EVs into the EU.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: India's deepening ties with natural gas
item.description: Maintaining the status quo means rising energy security risks as India's economy grows.

item.title: Apple's services unit is now a $100 billion a year juggernaut after 'phenomenal' growth
item.description: Apple's services business has become a critical part of the company's appeal to Wall Street over the past decade.

item.title: Amazon CEO pledges AI investments will pay off as capital expenditures surge 81%
item.description: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy reassured shareholders that the company expects to make money on its generative AI investments.

item.title: Comcast's potential cable networks separation will test the appetite for media reconfiguration
item.description: If Comcast moves forward with its idea of spinning off NBCUniversal's cable networks, it could begin a rollup throughout the media industry.

item.title: OpenAI launches ChatGPT search, competing with Google and Microsoft
item.description: OpenAI on Thursday launched ChatGPT search, positioning the company to better compete with search engines like Google, Microsoft's Bing and Perplexity.

item.title: Key inflation rate hits 2.1% in September, as expected, closing in on Fed target
item.description: The personal consumption expenditures price index was expected to increase 0.2% in September and 2.1% from a year ago.

item.title: Microsoft's stock has worst day in two years after disappointing forecast
item.description: Microsoft's stock fell more than 6% on Thursday after guidance fell short of analysts' estimates.

item.title: Switzerland is now flirting with deflation, causing a dilemma for its central bank
item.description: Switzerland could be at risk of slipping into deflationary territory next year as a stronger Swiss franc dogs policymakers' efforts to get a handle on prices.

item.title: Euro zone inflation rises to higher-than-expected 2%, weakening case for jumbo rate cut
item.description: The fresh inflation print is seen as crucial in judging whether the European Central Bank could consider a half-percentage-point interest rate cut.

item.title: Comcast is exploring separation of cable networks business
item.description: NBCUniversal's cable networks portfolio includes Bravo, E!, Syfy, Oxygen True Crime, USA Network, as well as news networks MSNBC and CNBC.

item.title: Coinbase drops 15% after earnings, posts worst day in more than two years
item.description: Coinbase slid a day after reporting weak earnings and gave a tepid revenue outlook.

item.title: Franklin Templeton CEO says focus is on 'doing what's right' for clients amid SEC probe
item.description: Franklin Templeton's largest subsidiary, Western Asset Management, saw $37 billion in outflows in the last three months.

item.title: Treasury Department announces new Series I bond rate of 3.11% for the next six months
item.description: The U.S. Department of the Treasury has announced new Series I bond rates through April 2025.

item.title: Oil giant Shell posts $6 billion profit beat, launches new share buyback program
item.description: British oil giant Shell on Thursday posted a small year-on-year drop in third-quarter profit as a sharp drop in crude prices was offset by higher gas sales.

item.title: Elon Musk moves $1 million voter lottery lawsuit to federal court — for now
item.description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk and his America PAC are supporting Donald Trump against Kamala Harris in the presidential election contest.

item.title: Dodge maker Stellantis posts 27% drop in revenues, flags progress in slashing U.S. inventories
item.description: Auto giant Stellantis on Thursday reported a 27% decline in third-quarter revenues, but said it was making headway in addressing operational issues like U.S. inventories.

item.title: Uber reports third-quarter results that beat Wall Street's revenue expectations
item.description: Uber reported third-quarter results Thursday that beat analysts' expectations for revenue.

item.title: Sovereign debt is the biggest risk to global growth in 2025, Saudi finance minister says
item.description: Global public debt hit a record $97 trillion in 2023, prompting the UN to call for urgent reforms for governments and financial systems around the world.

item.title: Jack Dorsey's payments company Block expands corporate card service to the UK
item.description: Block, the payments company owned by tech billionaire Jack Dorsey, has launched its corporate card service in the U.K.
